title: Typefaces made for Language
content:
I�m looking for examples and references of typefaces made with language in mind such as Gentium, Hrant�s Armenian types, Mayathan, Rayuela, etc...   
   
What is in the use of garaldes for french, blackletter for german, caslon for english?
author: rs_donsata

comments.content:
I think my Armenian stuff doesn't apply because there's only one language that uses the Armenian script... And my Latin stuff isn't that "sensitive", yet... And fonts like Gentium that are so multi-purpose they can't really exhibit what you're looking for. So I think what you need is fonts that are Latin but are focused on one single language besides English - like one of those Morisawa winners?   
   
BTW, you should check this out:   
 [http://cajun.cs.nott.ac.uk/compsci/epo/papers/volume6/issue1/ep075lmf.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221433/http:/cajun.cs.nott.ac.uk/compsci/epo/papers/volume6/issue1/ep075lmf.pdf)   
   
hhp

\> one of those Morisawa winners?   
   
Not 'one of those winners', _the_ winner!   
 [Australis](http://web.archive.org/web/20050526221433/http:/www.tipografia.cl/proyectos/australis.htm), by Francisco Galvez.
